intro: Thelesperma intermedium, commonly known as plains bluebells, is a flowering plant native to the central and southern United States. It is a member of the Fabaceae family, which includes legumes, and is characterized by its compound leaves and showy blue to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, sandy soils and is often found in grasslands and open woodlands. It has a deep root system that helps it survive in arid conditions, and it produces small, pod-like fruits that contain seeds. Thelesperma intermedium is an important plant for pollinators and contributes to the ecological diversity of its habitat.
